title: How to receive assets in Service Asset and Configuration Management
content:
You can receive assets as part of the standard SACM workflow (and add them as SACM records) within each of the relevant parts of Service Management. For example, you can use the Devices part to receive devices, the Infrastructure & Peripherals part to receive infrastructure assets, and the Enterprise Assets part to receive enterprise assets. However, Service Management also allows you to receive multiple types of assets at the same time.

You can receive assets from SACM Home or Stock Management, either manually, or by importing the data from an electronic version of an advance ship notice (ASN), or similar documentation.

  • You can import up to 10,000 records at a time, either manually or in a single ASN file.
  • You can import up to 40,000 records within 24 hours on a single tenant.
  • You must have Advanced import permission to receive assets.

From SACM Home

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration.

  2. Click the Receive assets link in the upper right corner. The Receive assets dialog box is displayed.

  3. Complete the following information:

    General section
    Field Description
    Vendor The vendor of the asset.
    Contract The purchase or lease contract with the Vendor under which the received asset is provided.

    Phase Id

    The relevant workflow phase that the received asset will be in. One of:

    • In use

    • In stock
      Note: When the received asset is an Enterprise Asset and the process type of the enterprise asset is Stationary, the asset will be 'Ready'.
    Stockroom The stockroom where the received assets will be stocked. When selecting In stock for the Phase Id, the Stockroom field will be displayed.
    Owner The person who manages the asset on its receipt.
    Location

    The physical location of the asset. This field is read-only and auto-filled when you choose a stockroom in the Stockroom field.
    Method

    How the asset is received. One of:

    • Manual

    • Advance ship notice

  4. For Manual:

    1. Click . The Asset details dialog box is displayed.

    2. Complete the following information:

      Field Description
      Asset tag prefix The prefix for the asset tag identifier. Service Management automatically generates a unique numerical identifier for each asset, adding it to the selected prefix. For example, if the selected asset tag prefix is Server, the complete asset tag might be something like Server1927.
      Asset type

      The asset type is one of:

      • Device

      • Infrastructure & Peripheral

      • Enterprise Asset
      Sub type A level of categorization cascaded from the asset type. For example, if the asset is a device, the available sub types are device sub types.
      Asset model

      The definitive model to which the asset belongs. For example, HP EliteBook Folio 9470m.

      • The available asset models depend on the selected asset type and sub type.

      • If asset type and sub type are blank, and an asset model is selected, this automatically populates the asset type and sub type fields.
      Warranty end date The date the warranty for this asset ends.
      Unit price The amount paid to acquire each such asset.
      Currency Currency of the unit price.
      External PO number The relevant purchase order number.

      Quantity

      		 The number of assets, as detailed in the preceding fields, to add.
      Serial number The serial number of the assets.

      A summary of the assets (model and quantity) is displayed in the left panel.

    3. To add further assets, click .

    4. To remove assets, click X at the end of the relevant row in the left pane.

    5. To edit the asset details before receipt:

      1. Select the row to edit in the left pane.

      2. Edit the properties in the right pane.

    6. When all the relevant asset details have been added correctly, click Receive.

  5. For Advance ship notice:

    1. Click Select ship notice.

    2. Navigate to and select the appropriate CSV file.

      You can't import a file with the same content more than once.

      For more information, see Advance ship notice format.

    3. Click Open. The file is read and interpreted, and then displayed in the bottom panes of the dialog box.

      If there are any errors in the file, an error indication is displayed in the left pane, and the Receive button is disabled. To see the detailed error information, select the corresponding record in the left pane. You must correct the errors to allow the process to continue.

      Examples of possible errors include:

      • Unsupported asset type.

      • Asset model can't be reconciled against existing Service Management asset model records.

    4. Click Receive.

From Stock Management

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration.

  2. From SACM Home, select Stock Management.

  3. Select the stockroom, and click Details.

  4. Click Receive assets on the toolbar. The Receive assets in stockroom dialog box is displayed.

    The Receive assets button is displayed only if the stockroom is operational (a stockroom is operational when it's in the Operational phase of the workflow).

  5. Complete the following information:

    Field Description
    Vendor The vendor of the asset.
    Contract The purchase or lease contract with the Vendor under which the received asset is provided.
    Phase Id

    The relevant workflow phase that the received asset will be in. By default, it is In stock.
    Stockroom By default, the selected stockroom is displayed, and may not be edited.
    Owner The person who manages the asset on its receipt.
    Location

    The physical location of the asset. This field is read-only and automatically pre-populated with the selected stockroom location.
    Method

    How the asset is received. One of:

    • Manual

    • Advanced ship notice

  6. For Manual:

    1. Click . The Asset details dialog box is displayed.

    2. Complete the following information:

      Field Description
      Asset tag prefix The prefix for the asset tag identifier. Service Management automatically generates a unique numerical identifier for each asset, adding it to the selected prefix. For example, if the selected asset tag prefix is Server, the complete asset tag might be something like Server1927.
      Asset type

      The asset type is one of:

      • Device

      • Infrastructure & Peripheral

      • Enterprise Asset
      Sub type A level of categorization cascaded from the asset type. For example, if the asset is a device, the available sub types are device sub types.
      Asset model

      The definitive model to which the asset belongs. For example, HP EliteBook Folio 9470m.

      • The available asset models depend on the selected asset type and sub type.

      • If asset type and sub type are blank, and an asset model is selected, this automatically populates the asset type and sub type fields.
      Warranty end date The date the warranty for this asset ends.
      Unit price The amount paid to acquire each such asset.
      Currency Currency of the unit price.
      External PO number The relevant purchase order number.
      Quantity The number of assets, as detailed in the preceding fields, to add.
      Serial number The serial number of the assets.

      A summary of the assets (model and quantity) is displayed in the left panel.

    3. To add further assets, click .

    4. To remove assets, click X at the end of the relevant row in the left pane.

    5. To edit the asset details before receipt:

      1. Select the row to edit in the left pane.

      2. Edit the properties in the right pane.

    6. When all the relevant asset details have been added correctly, click Receive.

  7. For Advance ship notice:

    1. Click Select ship notice.

    2. Navigate to and select the appropriate CSV file.

      You can't import a file with the same content more than once.

      For more information, see Advance ship notice format.

    3. Click Open. The file is read and interpreted, and then displayed in the bottom panes of the dialog box.

      If there are any errors in the file, an error indication is displayed in the left pane, and the Receive button is disabled. To see the detailed error information, select the corresponding record in the left pane. You must correct the errors to allow the process to continue.

      Examples of possible errors include:

      • Unsupported asset type.

      • Asset model can't be reconciled against existing Service Management asset model records.

    4. Click Receive.

After successfully adding asset records, you can access the records in the corresponding module. For example, if you added device records, from SACM Home, select Devices to access the records.

Related topics

  • How to check asset records have been added properly to SACM
  • Advance ship notice format
